com.jayway.changeless.vectors
Interface Vector<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the elements of the vector.
All Superinterfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<T>, Sequenceable<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
VectorSupport
public interface Vector<T>
extends Sequenceable<T>

A vector is a growable array of objects where integer indexes maps to elements.

Method Summary
 Vector<T> add(T... elements)
          Returns a new vector containing the elements of this vector with the given elements appended to the end.
 T get(int index)
          Returns the element at the given index in this vector.
 boolean isEmpty()
          Returns true if this vector is empty; false otherwise.
 Vector<T> set(int index, T element)
          Returns a new vector where the element at the given index is set to the specified element.
 int size()
          Returns the number of elements in this vector.
 Vector<T> skip(int n)
          Returns a new vector containing all the elements of this vector except the n first elements.
 Vector<T> take(int n)
          Returns a new vector with the n first elements of this vector.

Method Detail

get

T get(int index)
Returns the element at the given index in this vector.

Parameters:
index - the index of the element to be retrieved.
Returns:
the element at the given index in this vector.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the index is less than zero or larger than or equals to the size of this vector.

set

Vector<T> set(int index,
              T element)
Returns a new vector where the element at the given index is set to the specified element.

Parameters:
index - the index of the element to be changed.
element - the element to be inserted in this vector.
Returns:
a new vector where the element at the given index is set to the specified element.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the index is less than zero or larger than or equals to the size of this vector.

Returns true if this vector is empty; false otherwise.

int size()
Returns the number of elements in this vector.

add

Vector<T> add(T... elements)
Returns a new vector containing the elements of this vector with the given elements appended to the end.

Parameters:
elements - the elements to be added.
Returns:
this vector with the given elements added to the end.

skip

Vector<T> skip(int n)
Returns a new vector containing all the elements of this vector except the n first elements. If n is less than one this vector is returned. Notice that the returned sequence is evaluated lazily.

take

Vector<T> take(int n)
Returns a new vector with the n first elements of this vector.

Parameters:
n - the number of elements to take from this vector.
Returns:
a new vector with the n first elements of this vector.
